5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Bad taste in mouth, Nausea, Vomiting
  • Neurologic:Dizziness, Headache
  • Ophthalmic:Burning sensation in eye, Conjunctivitis, Photophobia
  • Respiratory:Cough, Nasal congestion, Pain in throat, Rhinitis

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Nedocromil sodium is an anti-inflammatory agent that blocks the release of mediators of hypersensitivity reactions from mast cells, eosinophils, neutrophils, macrophages, monocytes and platelets. The drug inhibits the release of histamine from mast cells and beta-glucuronidase from macrophages in bronchoalveolar cells. It does not exert any bronchodilating, antihistaminic, or corticosteroid effects.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Inhalational: time to peak concentration, 28 min
  • Inhalational, asthmatic adults: time to peak concentration, 5 min to 90 min
  • Bioavailability: (inhalational), 17%
  • Bioavailability: (oral), less than 2%
  • Bioavailability: (ophthalmic), less than 4%

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Fecal: (IV, healthy adult male), 36% unchanged
  • Fecal: (ophthalmic), 30% unchanged
  • Renal: (inhalational, asthmatic adult), approximately 5% unchanged
  • Renal: (inhalational, healthy adult), 12% unchanged
  • Renal: (IV, healthy adult), approximately 70% unchanged
  • Renal: (IV, healthy adult male), 64% unchanged
  • Renal: (ophthalmic), 70% unchanged

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient that the inhaled formulation is not indicated for acute asthma attacks.
  • Inhaled preparation may cause a bad taste in mouth, nausea, vomiting, dizziness, headache, conjunctivitis, cough, nasal congestion, throat pain, or rhinitis. The ophthalmic formulation may also cause a burning sensation in the eye.
  • Tell patients using ophthalmic form to not wear contact lenses during drug therapy.
  • Instruct patient on proper administration technique, depending on formulation.
